title: Combined short command line arguments do not seem to work

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
#### What is the problem?
Combined short command line arguments do not seem to work
#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
```
me@christop ~/datalad (annex/direct/master) $ datalad ls -Lr .
[ERROR] unknown argument: -Lr
usage: datalad ls [-h] [-r] [-F] [-a] [-L] [--config-file CONFIG_FILE]
                  [--list-content {None,first10,md5,full}]
                  [--json {file,display,delete}]
                  [PATH/URL [PATH/URL ...]]
```
me@christop ~/datalad (annex/direct/master) $ datalad get -J4 openfmri/ds000*/sub-*/anat
[ERROR] unknown argument: -J4
usage: datalad get [-h] [-s LABEL] [-d PATH] [-r] [--recursion-limit LEVELS]
                   [-n] [-D DESCRIPTION] [--reckless] [-J NJOBS] [-v]
                   [PATH [PATH ...]]
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
Running current master
```
me@christop ~ $ datalad wtf

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
I like squirrels.

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
Still trying to get it to work :)
